Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery mug; interior: narrow reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior: upper part reserved, glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The rim and interior glaze find parallels with Samian Hera cups. However, unlike Hera cups which have dipinto dedications to the goddess, this cup has a graffito. Other similar mugs have been found in the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and thus this shape is not exclusive to Hera. For parallels with Hera cups, see British Museum 1888,0601.401, 1888, 0601.402, 1888.0601.403, and 1888,0601.405. For a parallel with a similar mug with a graffito inscription, see Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.227.1899.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.900) (phase 3)
